meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel less enthusiastic about something.
meanings.sent1: The constant criticism can putoffs people from trying new things.
meanings.sent2: She always makes negative comments that putoffs others from joining the team.
meanings.sent3: His habit of always pointing out flaws can be a real putoffs during group projects.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead seemed to putoffs any hope of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the room putoffs a sense of unease in everyone present.

meanings.definition: Something that causes someone to feel less enthusiastic about something.
meanings.sent1: The constant complaints about the food were real putoffs for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The long wait times at the restaurant were major putoffs for customers.
meanings.sent3: The broken air conditioning unit was a putoffs during the hot summer months.
meanings.sent4: The old, worn-out furniture in the waiting room was a visual putoffs for visitors.
meanings.sent5: The lack of cleanliness in the restroom was a strong putoffs for potential customers.
